textBeforeTable: dio     declension of Declension[edit] part dȉo m (Cyrillic spelling ди̏о) Noun[edit] Hyphenation: di‧o IPA(key): /dîo/ Pronunciation[edit] From Proto-Slavic *dělъ. Etymology[edit] (Ekavian): dȅo Alternative forms[edit] Serbo-Croatian[edit] resplendent light ¶ of the lesser circle a modest voice, [...] [...] And I heard in the most dia ¶ del minor cerchio una voce modesta, [...] [...] E io udi' nella luce più 1321, Dante Alighieri, La divina commedia: Paradiso, Le Monnier (2002), Canto XIV, p. 250 vv. 34-35 bright, resplendent divine, godlike dio ‎(feminine
textAfterTable: Spanish[edit] Pronunciation[edit] IPA(key): /djo/ Verb[edit] dio Formal second-person singular (usted) preterite indicative form of dar. Third-person singular (él, ella, also used with usted?) preterite indicative form of dar. Turkish[edit] Verb[edit] dio (internet/sms) Alternative form of diyor Bana dio sen benim en yakınımsın.
